text.p: In light of the previous problem, for which sizes of matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] would it be impossible for [mathjaxinline]Ax = v[/mathjaxinline] to have at least one solution for every [mathjaxinline]v \in \mathbb R^5[/mathjaxinline]? Click all that apply.

font.p: If there are fewer than 5 columns, then it is impossible for the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] to span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^5[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore, by the previous problem, the equation [mathjaxinline]Ax=v[/mathjaxinline] cannot be consistent for every [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^5[/mathjaxinline]; there must be some vectors [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^5[/mathjaxinline] for which it is inconsistent.
